Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of interlinked lotus flower, pomegranate and rosette in added white outline with possible traces of added red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of animal, possibly a sphinx (rump and part of tail remaining) to right; part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos erroneously describes the sphinx as facing left. For parallels regarding the chain of pomegranates, see Lemos no. 1081 from Marion. For parallels regarding the tail, see Lemos no. 963 from Berezan.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 263, no. 551)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0528) (phase 2)
